note_text:
Indication: Metastatic RLL airway obstruction.
Anesthesia: General, ETT.
Procedure:
- Exam: Normal left side. RLL polypoid tumor obstructing basilar segments.
- Action: Snare resection performed. APC applied to base for hemostasis.
- Toileting: Purulent distal secretions suctioned.
Result: 90% patency achieved.
Plan: PACU.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Endobronchial nodule in setting of widely metastatic disease requiring tissue diagnosis

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal trachea and carina. Left airways normal. Right upper/middle normal. RLL polypoid tumor obstructing basilar segments.

cao_interventions_detail.notes: Polypoid tumor obstructing anterior, lateral, and posterior basilar segments. Removed via snare. Base cauterized with APC. 90% patent post-intervention.

outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Transfer to PACU. Await biopsy results. Discharge home once criteria met.

Bundled into 31641 when performed at same anatomic site (RLL).

per_code.summary: Primary therapeutic service for RLL tumor. Although snare excision (31640) was used, APC destruction was also performed. 31641 is the higher-valued code for the same site.
Separate therapeutic aspiration of purulent secretions from distal airways.

note_text: OPERATIVE REPORT: The patient presented with widely metastatic disease complicated by an endobronchial component. Under general anesthesia, rigid inspection of the tracheobronchial tree revealed a polypoid neoplasm occluding the anterior, lateral, and posterior basilar segments of the right lower lobe. Mechanical debulking was executed utilizing an electrocautery snare. Subsequent thermal ablation via Argon Plasma Coagulation (APC) was applied to the tumor base to ensure hemostasis. Post-obstructive purulence was evacuated via therapeutic aspiration. Re-establishment of lobar patency to approximately 90% was confirmed.

note_text:
Procedures Performed: Bronchoscopy with tumor destruction (CPT 31641) and therapeutic aspiration (CPT 31645).
Details: The RLL tumor was identified. Primary destruction was achieved using a combination of electrocautery snare and non-contact APC ablation (31641). Following tumor removal, distinct therapeutic aspiration was required to clear copious purulent secretions from the distal airways (31645). Hemostasis was confirmed.

note_text:
Procedure Note
Attending: [Name]
Resident: [Name]
Indication: RLL mass.
Steps:
1. Time out performed.
2. ETT placed.
3. Scope advanced to RLL.
4. Tumor visualized blocking basilar segments.
5. Snare used to remove tumor.
6. APC used to burn base.
7. Suctioned pus from behind the blockage.
8. Scope removed. No complications.

note_text: The patient was placed under general anesthesia and intubated. We inserted the bronchoscope and examined the airways. The left side was clear. In the right lower lobe, a polypoid tumor was found obstructing the basilar segments. We used an electrocautery snare to resect the lesion and then applied APC to the base for cauterization. We also performed therapeutic suctioning of purulent secretions found distally. The airway is now patent.

note_text: The patient was brought to the bronchoscopy suite and placed under general anesthesia. We introduced the bronchoscope through the endotracheal tube. Upon reaching the right lower lobe, we identified a polypoid tumor that was obstructing the anterior, lateral, and posterior basilar segments. We successfully removed the mass using an electrocautery snare. Following removal, we used APC to cauterize the base of the lesion. We also noted and removed purulent secretions from the distal airways. The procedure concluded with the airway largely patent.

note_text:
Procedure: Bronchoscopic resection and ablation.
Technique: The endobronchial mass in the RLL was excised using a hot loop. The attachment site was coagulated with argon plasma. Post-obstructive exudate was aspirated from the distal bronchi. The lumen was restored to 90% caliber.

note_text:
Dx: Post-pneumonectomy BPF.
Anesthesia: GA, 8.5 ETT.
Findings: Right tree normal. Left stump has pinpoint fistula.
Action: Glue applied via Veno-seal catheter.
Result: Fistula sealed visually.
 complications: None.

metadata.notes: Procedure performed using Veno-seal sealant delivery system.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: The distal trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The right sided tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level and bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal. The left mainstem stump was visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: BP fistula with successful occlusion via sealant

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy, rigid or flexible, including fluoroscopic guidance, when performed; diagnostic, with cell washing, when performed

lines.description: Bronchoscopy, rigid or flexible, including fluoroscopic guidance, when performed; diagnostic, with cell washing, when performed
lines.selection_reason: Primary procedure performed was bronchoscopy with visualization of the BPF. The therapeutic intervention (glue instillation) does not have a specific CPT code in the standard bronchoscopy family (31622-31661) and typically requires an unlisted code (31899), which is not available in the current fee schedule. 31622 captures the diagnostic work.

note_spans.snippet: The Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced... left mainstem stump was then visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Single procedure performed; no MPPR reduction applied.

per_code.summary: Selected as the primary code to capture the bronchoscopic evaluation of the bronchial tree and fistula. The specific therapeutic intervention (glue) is unlisted (31899) and thus 31622 is the highest-level specific code supported by the standard fee schedule.

documentation_evidence.snippet: The left mainstem stump was then visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula

global_comments: Endobronchial glue instillation for BPF is typically reported with unlisted code 31899.
As 31899 is not present in the reference fee schedule, 31622 is reported to capture the diagnostic component.
ICD-10 J98.09 (Bronchopleural fistula) supports medical necessity.

note_text: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient, status post-pneumonectomy, presented with a broncho-pleural fistula. Following induction of general anesthesia and placement of an 8.5 mm endotracheal tube, the airway was inspected. The right hemithorax was unremarkable. Examination of the left mainstem stump revealed a pinpoint fistulous tract. A Veno-seal delivery catheter was navigated to the site, and cyanoacrylate sealant was instilled. Visual confirmation suggested successful occlusion of the defect without propagation of the fistula.

metadata.notes: Procedure performed using Veno-seal sealant delivery system.

note_text:
Service: Bronchoscopy (CPT 31622). Note: Therapeutic intervention (glue) performed but billed as diagnostic due to coding limitations.
Findings: Visualization of left mainstem bronchial stump revealed a pinpoint broncho-pleural fistula.
Intervention: Endobronchial glue instillation using Veno-seal system. Fistula sealed. Right airways inspected and normal.

note_text:
Resident Note
Indication: BPF.
Staff: Dr. X.
Steps:
1. Patient intubated (8.5 ETT).
2. Scope introduced.
3. Checked right side - normal.
4. Looked at left stump - saw pinpoint leak.
5. Passed glue catheter.
6. Applied glue to hole.
7. Looks sealed.
Plan: Monitor.

metadata.notes: Procedure performed using Veno-seal sealant delivery system.

note_text: The patient was intubated and the bronchoscope was inserted. We examined the right bronchial tree which was normal. On the left, we visualized the post-pneumonectomy stump and identified a pinpoint broncho-pleural fistula. We advanced a catheter through the working channel and applied tissue glue to the fistula. The defect appeared to be sealed successfully. The scope was withdrawn.

metadata.notes: Procedure performed using Veno-seal sealant delivery system.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy, rigid or flexible, including fluoroscopic guidance, when performed; diagnostic, with cell washing, when performed
lines.selection_reason: Primary procedure performed was bronchoscopy with visualization of the BPF. The therapeutic intervention (glue instillation) does not have a specific CPT code in the standard bronchoscopy family (31622-31661) and typically requires an unlisted code (31899), which is not available in the current fee schedule. 31622 captures the diagnostic work.

note_spans.snippet: The Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced... left mainstem stump was then visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Single procedure performed; no MPPR reduction applied.

per_code.summary: Selected as the primary code to capture the bronchoscopic evaluation of the bronchial tree and fistula. The specific therapeutic intervention (glue) is unlisted (31899) and thus 31622 is the highest-level specific code supported by the standard fee schedule.

documentation_evidence.snippet: The left mainstem stump was then visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula

global_comments: Endobronchial glue instillation for BPF is typically reported with unlisted code 31899.
As 31899 is not present in the reference fee schedule, 31622 is reported to capture the diagnostic component.
ICD-10 J98.09 (Bronchopleural fistula) supports medical necessity.

note_text: We proceeded with the bronchoscopy to address the patient's post-pneumonectomy fistula. After establishing an airway with an 8.5 ETT, we navigated the bronchoscope to the carina. The right lung was clear. We carefully inspected the left stump and found a small, pinpoint fistula. Using the Veno-seal system, we applied glue directly to the defect. The fistula appeared to close completely upon inspection.

metadata.notes: Procedure performed using Veno-seal sealant delivery system.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: The distal trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The right sided tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level and bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal. The left mainstem stump was visualized with obvious pinpoint BP fistula.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Combined EBUS-TBNA and peripheral bronchoscopy.
NARRATIVE: The airway was secured with an LMA. A convex probe EBUS was utilized to survey the mediastinum; station 7 met sampling criteria and was aspirated, yielding benign lymphocytes. An ultrathin bronchoscope (PX190) was then navigated to the left upper lobe apical-posterior segment. The target nodule was identified visually. Micro-forceps biopsies were obtained. Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE) confirmed malignancy. Hemostasis was secured.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Endobronchial Ultrasound-Guided Transbronchial Needle Aspiration (EBUS-TBNA).
CLINICAL SUMMARY: Evaluation of mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
DETAILS: Under MAC, the EBUS scope was introduced. Sonographic evaluation identified enlargement of subcarinal (7) and paratracheal (4R, 4L) stations. Systematic sampling was performed with 5 passes per station using 22G and 19G needles. ROSE evaluation of station 4R demonstrated granulomatous inflammation. The procedure was concluded without incident.

per_code.summary: Selected based on EBUS-TBNA of 1 lymph node station (11R). Station 4R was visualized/measured but not sampled, so it does not count towards the station threshold for 31653.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed within the 11Rs lymph node

per_code.summary: Diagnostic inspection (Q190 scope) was performed, but is inherent to the more extensive EBUS procedure (31652) performed in the same session.

global_comments: Moderate sedation codes (99152/99153) are omitted because anesthesia services were provided by an anesthesia professional.

note_text: Under general anesthesia with an LMA, we performed an EBUS. We visualized station 4R but decided not to sample it. We proceeded to station 11R and performed 7 needle passes to obtain tissue for molecular markers. Rapid pathology confirmed adenocarcinoma. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Vocal cords normal. Trachea normal. Carina sharp. Right lower lobe stump intact. Left side normal.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy, rigid or flexible; with endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) guided transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s), trachea, main stem and/or lobar bronchus(i), single or first lobe

note_text:
[Indication]
Molecular markers.
[Anesthesia]
General, LMA.
[Description]
Station 4R imaged (8.4mm). Station 11R sampled (7 passes). ROSE: Adenocarcinoma.
[Plan]
Oncology f/u.

note_text: The patient presented for EBUS staging to obtain tissue for molecular markers. We used an LMA for the airway. We identified a lymph node at station 4R but elected to sample the node at station 11R instead. We performed seven passes to ensure sufficient tissue. The immediate pathology reading was consistent with adenocarcinoma.

note_text:
Procedure: EBUS-guided aspiration.
Target: Hilar node 11R.
Action: 4R was sonographically assessed but not entered. 11R was aspirated 7 times.
Result: Positive for adenocarcinoma.
